Part_3_PyQt5 module

Lama Hasbini EECE 435L - Lab 2 Part 3: GUI Development with PyQt5

class Part_3_PyQt5.Course(course_id: str, course_name: str, instructor: Instructor = None, enrolled_students=None)[source]

Bases: object

The Course class represents a course with an ID, name, and optionally an instructor and enrolled students.

Parameters:

  • course_id (str) – The unique ID of the course.

  • course_name (str) – The name of the course.

  • instructor (Instructor) – The instructor assigned to the course (optional).

  • enrolled_students (list) – A list of students enrolled in the course (optional).

Variables:

  • course_id (str) – Stores the unique course ID.

  • course_name (str) – Stores the name of the course.

  • instructor (Instructor) – Stores the instructor assigned to the course, if any.

  • enrolled_students (list) – Stores the students enrolled in the course.

add_student(student)[source]

Enrolls a student in the course.

Parameters:

student (Student) – The student to enroll.

to_json()[source]

Converts the course object into a JSON serializable dictionary.

Returns:

A dictionary containing the course’s details.

Return type:

dict

class Part_3_PyQt5.Instructor(name: str, age: int, email: str, instructor_id: str, assigned_courses=None)[source]

Bases: Person

The Instructor class inherits from Person and adds instructor-specific details such as instructor ID and assigned courses.

Parameters:

  • name (str) – The name of the instructor.

  • age (int) – The age of the instructor. It must be a non-negative integer.

  • email (str) – The email address of the instructor. It must follow a valid email format.

  • instructor_id (str) – The unique ID of the instructor.

  • assigned_courses (list) – A list of courses the instructor is assigned to teach (optional).

Variables:

  • instructor_id (str) – Stores the unique instructor ID.

  • assigned_courses (list) – Stores the courses the instructor is assigned to teach.

assign_course(course)[source]

Assigns a course to the instructor.

Parameters:

course (Course) – The course to assign the instructor to.

to_json()[source]

Converts the instructor object into a JSON serializable dictionary, including instructor-specific details.

Returns:

A dictionary containing the instructor’s details.

Return type:

dict

class Part_3_PyQt5.Person(name: str, age: int, email: str)[source]

Bases: object

The Person class represents a person with a name, age, and email.

Parameters:

  • name (str) – The name of the person.

  • age (int) – The age of the person. It must be a non-negative integer.

  • email (str) – The email address of the person. It must follow a valid email format.

Variables:

  • name (str) – This is where the person’s name is stored.

  • age (int) – This is where the person’s age is stored after validation.

  • _email (str) – This is where the person’s email is stored after validation.

introduce()[source]

Prints the introduction of the person, including their name and age.

to_json()[source]

Converts the person object into a JSON serializable dictionary.

Returns:

A dictionary containing the person’s details.

Return type:

dict

validate_age(age)[source]

Validates that the age is non-negative.

Parameters:

age (int) – The age to validate.

Raises:

ValueError – If the age is negative.

Returns:

The validated age.

Return type:

int

validate_email(email)[source]

Validates that the email is in the correct format.

Parameters:

email (str) – The email to validate.

Raises:

ValueError – If the email is in an invalid format.

Returns:

The validated email.

Return type:

str

class Part_3_PyQt5.SchoolManagementSystem[source]

Bases: QWidget

The SchoolManagementSystem class manages the overall functionality for handling students, instructors, and courses within the school.

Parameters:

  • students (list) – A list of students in the school (optional).

  • instructors (list) – A list of instructors in the school (optional).

  • courses (list) – A list of courses offered in the school (optional).

Variables:

  • students (list) – Stores the registered students in the system.

  • instructors (list) – Stores the registered instructors in the system.

  • courses (list) – Stores the courses offered in the system.

add_course()[source]

Adds a new course to the system after validating input fields. Displays success or error messages accordingly.

add_instructor()[source]

Adds a new instructor to the system after validating input fields. Displays success or error messages accordingly.

add_student()[source]

Adds a new student to the system after validating input fields. Displays success or error messages accordingly.

add_table_row(name, id_value, record_type)[source]

Adds a new row to the table with the specified name, ID, and record type. :param name: The name of the record (student, instructor, or course name). :type name: str :param id_value: The ID of the record. :type id_value: str :param record_type: The type of record (‘Student’, ‘Instructor’, or ‘Course’). :type record_type: str

assign_instructor_to_course()[source]

Assigns the selected instructor to the selected course.

create_buttons()[source]

Create buttons for saving, loading, and exporting data. This method initializes the layout for the buttons and connects them to their respective functionalities.

Parameters:

self (SchoolManagementSystem) – The instance of the class.

Variables:

button_layout (QHBoxLayout) – The layout for the button widgets.

create_course_tab()[source]

Creates the tab for managing courses, including input fields for course details and buttons for adding courses to the system.

create_display_table()[source]

Creates a table for displaying all students, instructors, and courses, with functionality to edit and delete records.

create_instructor_tab()[source]

Creates the tab for managing instructors, including input fields for instructor details and buttons for assigning instructors and adding them to the system.

create_search_bar()[source]

Creates a search bar for filtering records in the table.

create_student_tab()[source]

Creates the tab for managing students, including input fields for student details and buttons for registering students and adding them to the system.

delete_record(row, record_type)[source]

Deletes the selected record from the list of students, instructors, or courses.

Parameters:

  • row (int) – The row number of the record in the table.

  • record_type (str) – The type of record being deleted (‘Student’, ‘Instructor’, or ‘Course’).

edit_record(row, record_type)[source]

Edits the selected record based on its type and populates the inputs with its current values.

Parameters:

  • row (int) – The row number of the record in the table.

  • record_type (str) – The type of record being edited (‘Student’, ‘Instructor’, or ‘Course’).

export_to_csv()[source]

Export student, instructor, and course data to a CSV file. This method allows the user to save the current lists of students, instructors, and courses to a CSV file for easy sharing and analysis.

Parameters:

self (SchoolManagementSystem) – The instance of the class.

Variables:

file_name (str) – The name of the file selected for exporting data.

init_ui()[source]

Initializes the user interface by setting up the layout and creating tabs for students, instructors, courses, and additional UI components.

load_data()[source]

Load student, instructor, and course data from a JSON file. This method prompts the user to select a JSON file to load and populates the respective lists for students, instructors, and courses.

Parameters:

self (SchoolManagementSystem) – The instance of the class.

Variables:

data (dict) – The loaded data from the JSON file.

perform_search()[source]

Performs a search in the table based on the input criteria (Name, ID, or Type).

register_student_for_course()[source]

Registers the selected student for the selected course.

save_course_changes(course)[source]

Saves the changes made to the course record.

Parameters:

course (Course) – The course object being modified.

save_data()[source]

Save the current data of students, instructors, and courses to a JSON file. The method gathers all student, instructor, and course data, converts it to JSON format, and prompts the user to select a file location to save the data.

Parameters:

self (SchoolManagementSystem) – The instance of the class.

Variables:

data (dict) – The data to be saved, including students, instructors, and courses.

save_instructor_changes(instructor)[source]

Saves the changes made to the instructor record.

Parameters:

instructor (Instructor) – The instructor object being modified.

save_student_changes(student)[source]

Saves the changes made to the student record.

Parameters:

student (Student) – The student object being modified.

Display an error message dialog.

Parameters:

  • title (str) – The title of the error dialog.

  • message (str) – The message to be displayed in the dialog.

  • self (SchoolManagementSystem) – The instance of the class.

show_success(title, message)[source]

Display a success message dialog.

Parameters:

  • title (str) – The title of the success dialog.

  • message (str) – The message to be displayed in the dialog.

  • self (SchoolManagementSystem) – The instance of the class.

update_course_comboboxes()[source]

Updates the course selection comboboxes in both the student and instructor tabs with the latest course names.

update_display_table()[source]

Updates the display table with the current list of students, instructors, and courses.

validate_email(email)[source]

Validates that the provided email format is correct.

Parameters:

email (str) – The email to validate.

Raises:

ValueError – If the email format is invalid.

Returns:

True if valid, raises ValueError otherwise.

Return type:

bool

validate_id(input_id, id_type)[source]

Validates that the provided ID is not empty.

Parameters:

  • input_id (str) – The ID to validate.

  • id_type (str) – The type of ID (for error messaging).

Raises:

ValueError – If the ID is empty.

Returns:

True if valid, raises ValueError otherwise.

Return type:

bool

validate_name(name)[source]

Validates that the provided name contains only alphabetic characters and spaces.

Parameters:

name (str) – The name to validate.

Raises:

ValueError – If the name is invalid.

Returns:

True if valid, raises ValueError otherwise.

Return type:

bool

class Part_3_PyQt5.Student(name: str, age: int, email: str, student_id: str, registered_courses=None)[source]

Bases: Person

The Student class inherits from Person and adds student-specific details such as student ID and registered courses.

Parameters:

  • name (str) – The name of the student.

  • age (int) – The age of the student. It must be a non-negative integer.

  • email (str) – The email address of the student. It must follow a valid email format.

  • student_id (str) – The unique ID of the student.

  • registered_courses (list) – A list of courses the student is registered in (optional).

Variables:

  • student_id (str) – Stores the unique student ID.

  • registered_courses (list) – Stores the courses the student is registered in.

register_course(course)[source]

Registers a student for a course.

Parameters:

course (Course) – The course to register the student in.

to_json()[source]

Converts the student object into a JSON serializable dictionary, including student-specific details.

Returns:

A dictionary containing the student’s details.

Return type:

dict

Part_3_PyQt5.main()[source]

Main function to start the application. This function initializes the QApplication, creates the main window of the school management system, and enters the application’s main event loop.

Param:

None

Returns:

None
